learning_outcomes.description: understand the numerical methods used in computational science
be able to apply numerical methods to problems in practice.
develop, use, and understand software which uses numerical methods
understand the role of numerical methods in science
engage in scientific and technical communication

assessments.task_description: Students will work on sets of exercises, one for each of modules 1-4. The exercises will primarily consist of practical computer exercises, but can include mathematical and research tasks as well.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Exercises must be submitted via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Project on topic of student's choice. Students will submit a written report. Students will have an oral exam for their project. Oral exams will be held during from week 13 to the end of the exam period; times and dates will be individually arranged.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The written report for the project must be submitted via the course Blackboard site. Oral exams will be held during from week 13 to the end of the exam period; times and dates will be individually arranged.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Computer exercises

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

Computer labs

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

Lectures

Lectures will include a brief coverage of the core content, further material on programming, and case studies of the use of numerical methods in computational science.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Lectures will include a brief coverage of the core content, further material on programming, and case studies of the use of numerical methods in computational science.
